timeline.bodyText: It's better to issue an error message here instead of silently fixing a users bad option argument. Otherwise we are breeding such command line invocations.
timeline.author: olpaw

replies.bodyText: Ok. What would be the appropriate way to make the user aware of the error? Do I throw an exception to stop the native image run? Should Can log an error message and force an exit? Or do I log a warning message, reset the value to the default and carry on. Is there a standard API to implement the latter actions?
replies.author: adinn

replies.bodyText: See e.g. NativeImageOptions.getCStandard() on how we usually do this.
replies.author: olpaw

timeline.bodyText: Now that you have that abstraction in-between you could take the checking one level further by returning a Path here and react on InvalidPathException during construction (Paths.get) with a sensible UserError.abort message.
